intro: Biarum dispar, commonly known as the dwarf white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Biarum dispar is noted for its delicate appearance and is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
